text: Apodasmia similis, also known as oioi or jointed wire rush, is a plant that is endemic to New Zealand. It is a coastal plant but is also found around peat bogs and hot springs. It flowers from October to December and bears fruit from December to March. ==See also== *Wetlands of New Zealand ==References== ==External links== *Oioi at Te Ara: The Encyclopedia of New Zealand *Apodasmia similis at the New Zealand Plant Conservation Network Category:Flora of New Zealand Category:Restionaceae Category:Taxa named by Barbara G. Briggs Category:Taxa named by Lawrence Alexander Sidney Johnson
title: Apodasmia similis
